messageBody:
Robert Wenner wrote:

> On Thursday 15 July 2004 18:59, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> > I am confused, though: why does "throws Exception" in a test lead to
> > "throws Exception" in production code?
>
> I did not mean to imply that.
> Actually, I don't want "throws Exception" by default in production code.
> My only point was hiding cumbersome exception specifications.

OK.

> I'd as well prefer "throws MyColorException" to "throws Exception",
> assuming I have MyColorException as base for RedException,
> GreenException, and so on.

In production code, absolutely; but I just don't see what it buys me in
tests. I guess that's the summary.

> And my comment was on a situation where I test my own code and not someone
> else's (which throws whatever checked exceptions).

I'm not sure that makes much of a difference. :)

Take care.
